pullRequest.title: Issue #795 - Add built-in support for CARIN BB IG

commit.message:
Issue #795 - Add built-in support for CARIN BB IG

Signed-off-by: John T.E. Timm <johntimm@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText:
I'm not sure we can call this "STU1" yet.  it was balloted for STU1 but the link there is the ballot snapshot, not an approved STU version

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - Consumer-Directed Payer Data Exchange (CARIN Blue Button) STU1 (v0.1.0) [http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/2020Feb/](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/2020Feb/)
          
          
            
            - Consumer-Directed Payer Data Exchange (CARIN Blue Button) v0.1.0 [http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/2020Feb/](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/2020Feb/)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -139,8 +139,9 @@ For more information, please see: [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/NPM+P
 
 The IBM FHIR server has built-in support for the following:
 
-- Profiles defined in the base FHIR specification STU4 (v4.0.1)
-- US Core STU3 (v3.1.0)
+- Profiles defined in the base FHIR specification STU4 (v4.0.1) [http://hl7.org/fhir/profilelist.html](http://hl7.org/fhir/profilelist.html)
+- US Core STU3 (v3.1.0) [https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/index.html](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/index.html)
+- Consumer-Directed Payer Data Exchange (CARIN Blue Button) STU1 (v0.1.0) [http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/2020Feb/](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/2020Feb/)

nodes.bodyText: maybe add a test to loop through all the resources and validate them?

commit.message:
Issue #795 - Updates per PR feedback

Signed-off-by: John T.E. Timm <johntimm@us.ibm.com>

Issue #795 - moved ConstraintGeneratorTest to US Core project

Signed-off-by: John T.E. Timm <johntimm@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: spoke with john on this one and he said that, for some reason, the bluebutton IG doesn't include a package index.  so he had to manually generate it, and he performed this validation when he did that, so only valid resources are included in the index.
